p: Pure carvone oil has a pronounced impact as a suppressor of potato tuber germination during storage. The main biomarker for the validity of potato tuber antioxidant enzyme activities (peroxidase and polyphenol oxidase) was detected [ 56]. Moreover, the sprouting inhibition by caraway oil was accompanied by significantly decreased weight loss [ 60]. The active compounds, limonene, and carvone, in caraway oil, are known to suppress the sprouting of potato tubers via the inhibition of mitochondrial respiration and reducing carbohydrate degradation sugars [ 61]. Carvone may play a more specific role in the sprout growth of potato tubers, such as by inhibiting the key enzyme in the mevalonate pathway, which is the main pathway of gibberellin biosynthesis [ 62].
